Suppose you pass all exams but do not pass the course; is the conditional E ⊃ C true or false in that case?
The conditional E ⊃ C is false in this case, as you passed the antecedent (Ebut not the consequent (C).

Thus, as we’ve seen, the material conditional is false only when the antecedent is true and the consequent is false.
